q: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
h:
“One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
h:
“I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
h:
“You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.” —
Dan Millman

q: Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.
h:
“Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
h:
“Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.” —
Buddha

q: The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.
h:
“The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.” —
Dan Brown

q: A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.
h:
“A memory is a beautiful thing, it's almost a desire that you miss.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.
h:
“Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The present moment dies every moment to become the past , is reborn every moment into the future. All experience is now. Now never ends.
h:
“The present moment dies every moment to become the past , is reborn every moment into the future. All experience is now. Now never ends.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: The past has no power over the present moment.
h:
“The past has no power over the present moment. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
h:
“Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
h:
“I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.” —
Beverly Sills

q: The consequences of today are determined by the actions of the past. To change your future, alter your decisions today.
h:
“The consequences of today are determined by the actions of the past. To change your future, alter your decisions today.” —
Unknown

q: Don't let the past steal your present.
h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

q: Few things are more deceptive than memories.
h:
“Few things are more deceptive than memories.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
h:
“Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Do not regret the past. Look to the future.
h:
“Do not regret the past. Look to the future.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.
h:
“The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.
h:
“Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
h:
“A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.” —
Mark Twain

q: I'd rather welcome change than cling to the past.
h:
“I'd rather welcome change than cling to the past.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: It is children only who enjoy the present; their elders either live on the memory of the past or the hope of the future.
h:
“It is children only who enjoy the present; their elders either live on the memory of the past or the hope of the future.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
h:
“So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
h:
“Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.
h:
“We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.” —
George Washington

q: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
h:
“If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.
h:
“Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.” —
Doug Ivester

q: Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.
h:
“Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.
h:
“Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
h:
“The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Your past does not equal your future.
h:
“Your past does not equal your future.” —
Tony Robbins

q: People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.
h:
“People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
h:
“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Time goes from present to past.
h:
“Time goes from present to past.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
h:
“You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.” —
Richard Bach

q: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
h:
“Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Memory is the scribe of the soul.
h:
“Memory is the scribe of the soul.” —
Aristotle

q: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
h:
“No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
h:
“Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Yesterday is the past, tomorrow is the future, today is a gift - that's why it's called the present.
h:
“Yesterday is the past, tomorrow is the future, today is a gift - that's why it's called the present.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.
h:
“Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.” —
Robin Sharma

q: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
h:
“If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: If you want to keep your memories, you first have to live them.
h:
“If you want to keep your memories, you first have to live them.” —
Bob Dylan

q: It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.
h:
“It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.” —
Paulo Coelho
